<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<STUDY_SET>
<STUDY accession="SRP178136" alias="GSE124872" center_name="GEO" broker_name="NCBI">
     <IDENTIFIERS>
          <PRIMARY_ID>SRP178136</PRIMARY_ID>
          <SECONDARY_ID>PRJNA514051</SECONDARY_ID>
          <EXTERNAL_ID label="primary" namespace="BioProject">PRJNA514051</EXTERNAL_ID>
          <EXTERNAL_ID namespace="GEO">GSE124872</EXTERNAL_ID>
          <SUBMITTER_ID namespace="GEO">GSE124872</SUBMITTER_ID>
     </IDENTIFIERS>
     <DESCRIPTOR>
          <STUDY_TITLE>Multi-modal analysis of the aging mouse lung at cellular resolution</STUDY_TITLE>
          <STUDY_TYPE existing_study_type="Transcriptome Analysis"/>
          <STUDY_ABSTRACT>A) Whole lung tissue from 24 months (n=7) and 3 months old (n=8) mice was dissociated and single-cell mRNAseq libraries generated with Drop-Seq. B) Bulk RNA-seq data was generated from whole mouse lung tissue of old (n=3) and young (n=3) samples. C) Bulk RNA-seq data was generated from flow-sorted macrophages from old (n=7) and young (n=5) mice and flow-sorted epithelial cells from old (n=4) and young (n=4) mice. Overall design: Integration of bulk RNA-seq from whole mouse lung tissue and bulk RNA-seq from flow-sorted lung macrophages and epithelial cells was used to validate results obtained from single cell RNA-seq of whole lung tissue.</STUDY_ABSTRACT>
          <CENTER_PROJECT_NAME>GSE124872</CENTER_PROJECT_NAME>
     </DESCRIPTOR>
